name: Air Fryer Fresh-Caught Crappie
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: When spring is in the air, fried crappie is what all of the fishermen around here are talking about. This year I left the deep-fryer in the cabinet and used my air fryer for a healthier alternative. Serve with malt vinegar, tartar sauce, cocktail sauce, hot pepper sauce, or the condiments of your choice.
directions: Place crappie fillets in a bowl
Add salt and water to cover
Cover and let sit to draw out all the blood, about 30 minutes
Rinse fillets thoroughly to remove salt
Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions
Add cornmeal, flour, seasoned salt, paprika, pepper, and cayenne to a gallon-sized zip-top bag
Seal and shake until evenly combined
Drop 2 fillets into the bag, seal, and shake to coat
Spray the tops of the fillets with nonstick cooking spray
Place a layer of fillets in the air fryer basket, sprayed-side down, making sure none are overlapping
Spray the tops with cooking spray
Carefully flip and spray any chalky spots
Cook until crispy, about 4 minutes more
